definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Mercy falls like the gentle rain from the sky upon the earth.
sentences.chinese: 宽恕像一场从空中降到地面的及时雨。

sentences.english: Pamela told me to sprinkle shouts, timely rain.
sentences.chinese: 向我洒来甘美的喊叫，及时雨。

sentences.english: This timely rain saved farmers the trouble of irrigating the fields.
sentences.chinese: 这场及时雨省了农民浇地的麻烦。

sentences.english: Safety more timely rain, less education an afterthought.
sentences.chinese: 安全多下及时雨，教育少放马后炮。

sentences.english: The timely rain revived the droughtstricken crops.
sentences.chinese: 这场及时雨使受旱的禾苗都缓过来了。

sentences.english: The shower last night hit the nail on the head. The plants were nearly parched.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚下了一场及时雨，植物都快干死了。
幸好随后下了一场及时雨。

sentences.english: The timely rain after a long time of drought will certainly bring on the crops.
sentences.chinese: 久旱之后的这场及时雨肯定会有助于农作物的生长。

sentences.english: Since we were experiencing a drought on the island, the rain was a welcome relief.
sentences.chinese: 岛上正值干旱，所以这场及时雨使旱情得到了缓解。

definition: lit. to send charcoal in snowy weather (idiom)/fig. to provide help in sb's hour of need
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
anxious to help others resolve difficulties (idiom)
like a second parent (idiom); one's great benefactor
heart-strengthening shot/fig. a shot in the arm
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
to burn one's eyebrows/fig. desperately serious situation
joy from heaven (idiom); overjoyed at unexpected good news/unlooked-for happy event
distributing money, fighting for virtue (idiom); fig. generous in helping the needy
